title: Soares de Albergaria/Soeiro de Albergaria
common: There is a consensus about the surname origin utilization starting with the son of couple Soeiro Fernandes and Sancha Martins, Estêvão Soares de Albergaria, when he made a combination between his patronymic with the ownership of Morgado de Albergaria de São Mateus (Abranches de Soveral, Manuel, 2003, pp. 24, 27 ; Melo, Manuel Soares de Albergaria Paes de, 1952, pp. 39, 40). On the other hand, the ancestors of the couple had a confusion during centuries exposed by Manuel Abranches de Soveral in his work, that it is recommended to study (Abranches de Soveral, Manuel, 2003, pp. 24 - 29).

families.name: Soares de Albergaria - Lamego
history: Descendants of Álvaro Anes Soares de Albergaria and Maria de Anreade Cardoso.

people.name: Alvaro Anes Soares de Albergaria
history: Álvaro Anes Soares de Albergaria came from Lisboa to Lamego (Fernades, A. de Almeida, 1957, pp. 9), this is probably the city he was born. Considering the children listed to him in lineage books (Felgueiras, Gaio, 1939, Tomo 27, pp. 118 ; Morais, Cristóvão Alão de, 1943-1948, Tomo 4, Vol. 2, pp. 205), and the origin cited by A. de A. Fernades, he could be the Lamego notary mentioned in document of 03/18/1517 (Torre do Tombo, Chancelaria Régia, D. Manuel I, L. 10, fl. 97 (img. 113)).

The fact that his marriage with Maria de Anreade Cardoso allowed Anreade's family to use the coat of arms of Soares de Albergaria (Fernades, A. de Almeida, 1957, pp. 9) is indirectly confirmed by the coat of arms in chapel of the Lord of Calvary in Britiande (Torre do Tombo, Tribunal do Santo Oficio, Env. 319 [H] Clichés mediocres - Britiande: solares, ruas e paisagens, Depósito Frio, Estante 06, Prateleira 169).

marriages.name: Maria de Anreade Cardoso
history: According to A. de A. Fernandes (Fernades, A. de Almeida, 1957, pp. 9). Gaio cites her family, but he does not name her (Felgueiras, Gaio, 1939, Tomo 27, pp. 118).

children.name: Bernardo Alvares
history: The relationship is cited by lineage books (Felgueiras, Gaio, 1939, Tomo 27, pp. 118 ; Morais, Cristóvão Alão de, 1943-1948, Tomo 4, Vol. 2, pp. 205). He has the patronymic, and he also worked as a notary in Lamego (Torre do Tombo, Chancelaria Régia, D. João III, L. 37, fl. 121 V (img. 248) ; Torre do Tombo, Chancelaria Régia, D. João III, L. 3, fl. 189 V (img. 2227)), so there is evidence for this relationship, but there is no documentation citing it explicitly, as a consequence it is treated as hypothesis.

In the diligence for familiar of Holy Office of Domingos Jorge da Silva, a witness, Duarte Machado, informs the relationship between cousins Antonio Rodrigues (de Alvarenga) and Simão de Alvarenga, that confirms indirectly his relationship with his sister, Leonor de Albergaria (Torre do Tombo, Tribunal do Santo Oficio, Conselho Geral, Habilitações, Domingos, mç. 21, doc. 419, fl. 87v - 88(img. 198 - 199).).

children.name: Leonor Alvares
history: The relationship is cited by lineage books, but Gaio does not name her (Felgueiras, Gaio, 1939, Tomo 27, pp. 118 ; Morais, Cristóvão Alão de, 1943-1948, Tomo 4, Vol. 2, pp. 205). The main evidences for this relationship are her patronymic, Alvares, and a mention in the diligence for familiar of Holy Office of Domingos Jorge da Silva, where the witness Duarte Machado informs the relationship between cousins Antonio Rodrigues (de Alvarenga) and Simão de Alvarenga, that confirms indirectly her relationship with her brother, Bernardo Alvares (Torre do Tombo, Tribunal do Santo Oficio, Conselho Geral, Habilitações, Domingos, mç. 21, doc. 419, fl. 87v - 88(img. 198 - 199).).

people.name: Bernardo Alvares
history: He was notary in Lamego like his [supposed] father, the document that gives him the position also informs he was Squire of Prior of Crato, and it also adds that before him Francisco de Alvarenga, that could be his brother, was the notary (Torre do Tombo, Chancelaria Régia, D. João III, L. 3, fl. 189v (img. 227)). This hypothesis exposed here is supported by his sister to be named Leonor de Albergaria, according to Alão de Morais (Morais, Cristóvão Alão de, 1943-1948, Tomo 4, Vol. 2, pp. 205), but she is named Leonor de Alvarenga in his coat of arm (Torre do Tombo, Chancelaria Régia, D. João III, L. 27, fl. 111v (img. 183)). The descendants associated to him lived in Britiande also (Morais, Cristóvão Alão de, 1943-1948, Tomo 4, Vol. 1, pp. 197). We finish with this hypothesis presentation, presenting a document where Gaspar de Alvarenga, his son, starts working with his father (Torre do Tombo, Chancelaria Régia, D. João III, L. 23, fl. 67v (img. 68)). The hypothetical parental connection between Francisco de Alvarenga and Bernardo Alvares is reinforced by the surname flexibility (Monteiro, Nuno G., 2008 ; Gonçalves, Iria), but it becomes weak by Aires Vaz to be the notary before him (Torre do Tombo, Chancelaria Régia, D. Manuel I, L. 44, fl. 99v (img. 137)).

Part of the information shown here was delivered through e-mail by Doutor João Manuel Braz. In e-mail exchange with Manuel Abranches de Soveral, I was informed that his work with PhD João Manuel Braz brings more details about the family Alvarenga (Abranches de Soveral, Manuel & Braz, João Manuel, 2023)).

In the diligence for familiar of Holy Office of Domingos Jorge da Silva, a witness, Duarte Machado, informs the relationship between cousins Antonio Rodrigues (de Alvarenga) and Simão de Alvarenga, that confirms indirectly his relationship with his sister, Leonor de Albergaria (Torre do Tombo, Tribunal do Santo Oficio, Conselho Geral, Habilitações, Domingos, mç. 21, doc. 419, fl. 87v - 88(img. 198 - 199).).

people.name: Leonor Alvares
history: Her relationship with the family is cited by Alão de Morais (Morais, Cristóvão Alão de, 1943-1948, Tomo 4, Vol. 2, pp. 205). We understand this connection has logic, because in the diligence for familiar of Holy Office of Domingos Jorge da Silva, a witness, Duarte Machado, informs the relationship between cousins Antonio Rodrigues (de Alvarenga) and Simão de Alvarenga, and these two are descendant of Bernardo Alvares and her (Torre do Tombo, Tribunal do Santo Oficio, Conselho Geral, Habilitações, Domingos, mç. 21, doc. 419, fl. 87v - 88(img. 198 - 199).
Her generation will be exposed in her husband family.
